meanings.definition: Consisting of or written in lines of equal length.
meanings.sent1: The stichic poem had lines that were all the same length.
meanings.sent2: Her stichic writing style made the poem flow smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The stichic format of the story made it easy to read aloud.
meanings.sent4: The stichic structure of the building gave it a sense of balance.
meanings.sent5: The stichic pattern of the fabric created a neat and tidy look.

meanings.definition: A form of poetry characterized by lines of equal length.
meanings.sent1: The poet's stichic was evident in the consistent line lengths.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed writing stichic because it gave her poems a unique rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The stichic poem was so organized, it almost looked like a list.
meanings.sent4: His stichic verses marched down the page like soldiers in formation.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of stichic poetry lies in its structured simplicity.
